summary: Build a complete, professional, playable browser-based (HTML5 + JavaScript) 2D top-down realistic tycoon/manager game named "HIPER SUPERMERCADO MANAGER" where the player grows from a small market into a full hypermarket, managing all operations (store layout, departments, customers AI, staff, inventory/logistics, finance, marketing, delivery, competition, progression, and premium currency simulation).
architectural_notes: Target platform: browser game using HTML5 + JavaScript.
No real-money payments; design premium currency system as simulated but architecture ready for future payment/backend integration.
Project should be optimized, organized, and scalable; structured like a commercial-grade game.
Include autosave, professional UI, lightweight animations, ambient audio.
Plan for mobile web support: responsive UI scaling, touch-first input, and performance constraints for mobile browsers.

existing_features.title: Create the core game shell for "HIPER SUPERMERCADO MANAGER" with a 2D top-down playable simulation loop running in the browser: start/pause/speed controls, in-game clock/calendar (days), and a deterministic tick/update system that drives customers, employees, inventory, queues, finances, reputation, and missions.

Implement the 2D top-down map and environment system: a buildable store layout with entrance/exit, aisles, checkout area with multiple registers, and distinct zones for parking, internal warehouse, admin office, loading/unloading bay, and delivery staging area. The store area must be expandable as progression unlocks space.

Implement customer AI with the required customer archetypes: Economic, Demanding, Impulsive, Loyal, and Wholesaler. Customers must choose where/what to buy based on price, quality, cleanliness, and queue time; they can abandon carts and rate the store from 1–5 stars.

Implement the employee system with the required roles: Cashier, Stocker, Butcher, Baker, Warehouse Clerk, Manager, Cleaning, Security, Delivery Driver. Include salary, productivity, fatigue, training, absences, and hire/fire flows. Staffing must affect throughput (replenishment speed, checkout speed, order picking/delivery, cleanliness).

Create a professional, clear UI/UX suitable for a commercial tycoon/manager game: dashboard (cash, reputation, date), build mode, department management, inventory & suppliers, staffing, marketing, online orders, reports/analytics, missions, and settings. All UI text must be in English.

Add a cohesive, distinctive visual theme for the entire UI and game presentation (colors, typography, layout, icon style) suitable for a realistic top-down supermarket tycoon. Keep it consistent across all screens and avoid default template styling.
Add branding: show the title "HIPER SUPERMERCADO MANAGER" and the copyright notice "© ITA Games Studios – All rights reserved" on the title screen and in an in-game credits/about panel.

Implement all supermarket departments/sectors listed by the user and make them first-class gameplay systems. Each sector must have its own stock, demand model, staffing needs, profitability metrics, and a sector quality level that influences customer purchasing decisions and reviews.

Add agent pathfinding and movement on the 2D top-down map for customers and employees, including impassable tiles, collision avoidance (at minimum grid blocking), and queue formation at checkout registers. Support customer travel flow: parking → entrance → selected sectors → checkout → exit.

Implement a cleanliness system: cleanliness decays over time based on customer traffic and operational load; cleaning staff restore cleanliness. Cleanliness must affect customer purchase decisions and store reputation.

Implement reputation & marketing: a store reputation score driven by customer reviews and operational KPIs, plus marketing campaigns (Flyers, Radio, Social Media, TV) with costs, durations, and measurable impacts on customer flow.

Implement simulated premium currency and a premium shop selling equipment/automation/upgrade items purchasable only with premium currency. The system must be explicitly non-monetized now, but structured so a future real-payment integration could replace only the currency top-up source.

Implement autosave and persistent game state storage using the Motoko backend, including manual save/load slots and periodic automatic saves. Persist at minimum: map/layout, sector unlocks, inventories, employees, finances, missions, reputation, progression, and online orders/deliveries.

Add lightweight 2D animations and ambient sound effects (toggleable) for: customer movement, register activity, delivery arrivals, subtle UI transitions, and looping store ambience. Provide volume controls and the ability to disable audio for performance/accessibility.

Add performance and scalability features: rendering optimizations suitable for large maps and many agents, structured code organization for simulation vs rendering, and a debug/profiling overlay showing FPS, tick time, active agent count, and queue lengths.

Ensure branding is applied consistently in all relevant screens: show the title "HIPER SUPERMERCADO MANAGER" and the copyright notice "© ITA Games Studios – All rights reserved" on the title screen and in an in-game credits/about panel, with all other UI text in English.

Add generated static image assets for a cohesive, realistic 2D top-down supermarket tycoon presentation (logo/title art and a small tile/sprite set) and render them from frontend/public/assets/generated (do not serve images via the backend).

Make the app layout fully responsive on mobile (320px width and up) for the Title Screen, Profile Setup flow, Store Initializer flow, and in-game HUD, ensuring no UI is clipped off-screen and primary actions remain reachable with one hand.

Update the in-game HUD to be touch-friendly on mobile by increasing tap target sizes, preventing control crowding, and adapting the bottom action row into a mobile-friendly layout (e.g., wrapping, compact labels, or a more mobile-appropriate arrangement) while keeping all user-facing text in English.

Make the game canvas responsive and mobile-performant by sizing it to the available viewport/container instead of a fixed 800x600, and render at an appropriate devicePixelRatio (clamped) to keep visuals crisp without overloading mobile GPUs.

Improve mobile input handling in the game view to avoid accidental browser gestures and provide predictable touch interactions for gameplay viewing (at minimum: prevent unwanted page scroll while interacting with the game canvas; ensure UI remains scrollable where intended such as sheets/panels).
Optimize the canvas render loop for mobile browsers by avoiding unnecessary fixed-interval redraws and reducing rerender frequency when possible, while preserving the current visual behavior.

Make the Sectors panel content mobile-friendly by ensuring tables/cards are readable on small screens (e.g., responsive typography, wrapping, and allowing horizontal scroll for the table region if needed) without breaking desktop layout.

new_feature_requests.summary: Core 2D top-down supermarket map & environment (store layout with aisles/entrance/exit/cashiers, expandable area, parking, warehouse, office, loading/unloading, delivery area, branches)

All supermarket departments/sectors with per-sector inventory, demand, profit, staffing and quality (hortifruti, butcher, fish, bakery, dairy, grocery, drinks, frozen, cleaning, hygiene, pet, electronics, home goods, bazaar, pharmacy, organics, wholesale)
Realistic customer AI with customer types, decision factors (price/quality/cleanliness/queue time), cart abandonment, and 1–5 star store ratings
Employee system (roles, salaries, productivity, fatigue, training, absences, hiring/firing) including cashier, stocker, specialists, manager, cleaning, security, delivery driver
Real-time inventory & logistics (expiration dates/spoilage losses, multiple suppliers with variable price/lead time/quality, delivery trucks, stockouts affecting reputation)
Economy & finance systems (daily cashflow, profit/loss, fixed costs, per-product pricing, promotions, seasonal dates/events)
Reputation & marketing system (reputation score tied to reviews; marketing channels with cost/impact on customer flow)
Online shopping & delivery (order picking from inventory, home delivery with vehicles, delays impacting reputation)
Expansion & competition (expand store/open sectors/build chain of hypermarkets; AI competitors that adjust prices/marketing)
Missions, progression, achievements and ranking
Simulated premium currency and premium shop (equipment/automation/upgrades) prepared for future payment integration without real payments now
Technical foundations: autosave, professional UI, 2D realistic graphics, light animations, ambient sounds, performance optimization, scalable codebase, backend-ready structure

Add pathfinding and movement for agents (customers, employees, delivery/picking staff) on the 2D map, including collision/impassable tiles, queues at checkouts, and travel between parking → entrance → departments → checkout → exit.

Implement ALL supermarket departments/sectors listed by the user. Each sector must have: its own inventory, demand model, pricing, profitability, staffing requirements, and a quality level that affects customer decisions and reviews.

Create a product catalog system with per-product: base cost, sell price (player-adjustable), supplier options, shelf/sector assignment, unit demand drivers, and expiration/validity (where applicable). Products must expire and generate losses when spoiled.

Implement real-time inventory & logistics: ordering from multiple suppliers (with variable price, lead time, and quality), inbound deliveries (trucks), receiving into warehouse, replenishment to shelves by employees, and stockouts affecting reputation and sales.
Add a cleanliness system: store cleanliness decays over time with customer traffic and operational load; cleaning staff restore it. Cleanliness must affect customer decisions and reputation.

Build checkout operations: multiple cash registers, assign cashiers, per-customer basket scanning time, queueing behavior, and lost sales due to long lines. Provide UI to open/close registers and view per-register metrics.

Implement economy & finance: daily cashflow, profit/loss, fixed costs (energy, water, rent, taxes, salaries), per-product pricing, promotions, and seasonal events (Christmas, Easter, Black Friday) that affect demand and pricing strategy.

Implement reputation & marketing: a store reputation score driven by customer reviews and operational KPIs, plus marketing campaigns (Flyers, Radio, Social Media, TV) with costs and impacts on customer flow.

Implement expansion & progression: unlocking new sectors, expanding floor space, upgrading capabilities, and enabling 'branch stores' (multiple locations) with separate P&L and shared corporate overview. Include AI competitors that adjust prices/marketing and influence market demand.

Add missions, progression rewards, achievements, and ranking: main and side missions (revenue targets, sector openings, max reputation), achievements tracking, and a ranking/leaderboard view (local/in-canister, no third-party services).

Implement simulated premium currency and a premium shop that sells cosmetic/automation/upgrade items using premium currency only. The system must be explicitly non-monetized now, but structured so a future payment integration could replace the currency top-up source.

Implement autosave and persistent game state storage using the Motoko backend, including manual save/load slots and automatic periodic saves. Ensure state includes map/layout, inventories, employees, finances, missions, reputation, and progression.

Add lightweight 2D animations and ambient sound effects (toggleable): customer movement, register activity, delivery arrivals, subtle UI transitions, and looping store ambience. Provide volume controls and the ability to disable audio for performance/accessibility.

Performance and scalability: implement rendering optimizations for large maps and many agents (e.g., culling/virtualization strategies appropriate for the chosen 2D renderer), structured code organization, and simulation profiling/debug overlays for FPS/tick time/agent count.

Create a product catalog system with per-product attributes: base cost, player-adjustable sell price, sector assignment, supplier options, demand drivers, and expiration/validity when applicable. Products must be able to spoil/expire and generate losses when unsold past validity.

Implement expansion & progression: unlock new sectors, expand store floor space, and enable branch stores (multiple locations) with separate P&L and a corporate overview. Add AI competitors that adjust prices/marketing and influence market demand.

Add missions and progression rewards: main and side missions (revenue targets, sector openings, reach max reputation), achievements tracking, and a ranking/leaderboard view stored locally/in-canister (no third-party services).
